title: Chinese embassy donates proceeds from charity sale to Malawi International Women's Association
description: On October 30, 2010, the Chinese embassy donated proceeds from charity sale to Malawi International Women's Association, according to the Chinese Embassy and Chinese Ministry of Commerce. The charity sale is called the annual Lilongwe International Charity Bazaar. At the charity sale, the embassy sold Chinese food and cultural items. The amount of the donation is unknown.  Similar donations from Chinese embassy events have been donated to IWAM in 2009 (#58217), in 2015 (#58096) and in 2017 (#58644).
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
Chinese embassy donates proceeds from charity sale to Malawi International Women's Association

# Description
On October 30, 2010, the Chinese embassy donated proceeds from charity sale to Malawi International Women's Association, according to the Chinese Embassy and Chinese Ministry of Commerce. The charity sale is called the annual Lilongwe International Charity Bazaar. At the charity sale, the embassy sold Chinese food and cultural items. The amount of the donation is unknown.  Similar donations from Chinese embassy events have been donated to IWAM in 2009 (#58217), in 2015 (#58096) and in 2017 (#58644).
justification: Project is a charitable donation to support women's association, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Donation from charity sale proceeds to Malawi International Women's Association, focus on social development

title: Chinese government funds scholarships for 25 students to study in China
description: On August 25, 2010, the Chinese government awarded the Chinese Government Scholarships for 25 Malawian students to study in China for the 2010/11 academic year. The value of the scholarships is unknown.

# Title

evidence: Education-focused scholarships for students, no energy or infrastructure components

title: FAO-China South South Cooperation Trust Fund sends 21 China agricultural experts to Malawi (Linked to #48940, Umbrella #87769)
description: On August 8, 2010, the Chinese Government committed to send 5 agricultural experts and 16 agricultural technicians to assist Malawi (Project #58138). The monetary value of the technical assistance program is recorded in the Government of Malawi's Aid Management Platform as $1,050,098 (see Project #48940). This was financed through the FAO-China South South Cooperation Trust Fund (see Umbrella Project #87769).   The project was scheduled to last for 2 years. According to a UN FAO report, 18 Chinese experts and technicians were deployed to Malawi, and over the two year period, Chinese experts introduced 106 new agricultural techniques, 60 new plant varieties, and six pieces of agricultural equipment and tools.  This project was completed on October 16, 2012.
staff_comments: This project captures the free-standing technical assistance and Project #48940 captures the grant financing.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
FAO-China South South Cooperation Trust Fund sends 21 China agricultural experts to Malawi (Linked to #48940, Umbrella #87769)

# Description
On August 8, 2010, the Chinese Government committed to send 5 agricultural experts and 16 agricultural technicians to assist Malawi (Project #58138). The monetary value of the technical assistance program is recorded in the Government of Malawi's Aid Management Platform as $1,050,098 (see Project #48940). This was financed through the FAO-China South South Cooperation Trust Fund (see Umbrella Project #87769).   The project was scheduled to last for 2 years. According to a UN FAO report, 18 Chinese experts and technicians were deployed to Malawi, and over the two year period, Chinese experts introduced 106 new agricultural techniques, 60 new plant varieties, and six pieces of agricultural equipment and tools.  This project was completed on October 16, 2012.
justification: Project focuses on agricultural technical assistance and knowledge transfer without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Agricultural experts and technicians, introduction of new techniques and plant varieties, no energy-related components mentioned

title: Chinese embassy donates books to school in Dowa
description: On July 24, 2010, the Chinese embassy donated books to a school in Dowa, Malawi. The donation was granted to the “Promoting Family Self-reliance Agricultural Technical School” (SAFI) during a ceremony for the "2009 Outstanding Achievement Award." The value of the donation is unknown.

evidence: Book donation to school, education sector focus
